answers.answer: Well, being that you're an insulin dependent diabetic, and this is happening first thing in the morning, my hunch would be an issue with your glucose level (either too high or too low).  You need to talk to your doctor, who will likely order some fasting bloodwork, to see what's going on.  If it's determined that this nausea isn't caused by your diabetes, then your doctor will have to explore some other possibilities.You posted this in an anxiety forum, so I'm guessing you're wondering if these symptoms are anxiety related?  Are you experiencing anxiety at all?  Are you anxious before the symptoms present themselves?  Do you have a history of anxiety?Keep us posted on how you're doing!
Do you take a multivitamin in the morning before this happens?  Some have poorly absorbed minerals that can cause this reaction, particularly some forms of iron.

question: I am a diabetic person and has daily insulin. why in the morning time I want to vomit and  followed by a stool?
title: morning vomitting and vowel
